intro: Catunaregam oocarpa, commonly known as the Amazonian starfruit or wild starfruit, is a tropical shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the common starfruit. The plant produces clusters of white flowers that are often pollinated by insects. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the stems are woody and covered in fine hairs. The fruit is edible, with a tart flavor and a juicy pulp that contains numerous small seeds.
